channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overhanging private trees crushing small tree on pavement., 30th October
item.description:
There are a row of very overgrown privately owned trees overhanging the whole of Sundridge ave and crushing a new small tree on the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sundridge Avenue, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Prescription drugs and controlled substances scatters across pathway, 30th October
item.description:

item.title: Abandoned Car, 30th October
item.description:
This car has been left in the front car park of Thompsons Garden Centre since Monday 27th October and is unlocked with no note or anything to say why it has been left.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 353, Shooters Hill, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road and alley way flood, 30th October
item.description:
I know that this has ben reported before - the bottom of Forest Way floods even in not very heavy rain. Water flows into the alleyway and into the drive of 185 Oakdene and then out into the alleyway which floods as the drains are either blocked or inadequate.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakdene Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing pavement block, 30th October
item.description:
Theres been multiple works on this road by thames water/the council and now one of the blocks has come away from the edge of the pavement. It needs a complete rework, I rolled my ankle this morning as well as my dog getting bits of concreate stuck in his paws. I noticed it on my return from work last night.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brenchley Close, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dear local aerial manager could you please address this issue last year summer 2023. where a resident who lives daintry way E9 5JJ has been going around the Daintry way courtyard with a jet washer washing all the paving stones with a high pressure rised jet washer which has made all paving stones come loose because all the sand and grout has been jet washed at high pressure causing it to come loose and wobbly. The local aerial manager Denise Corbin is aware and she even praised resident on a good job making the area nice But she doesn't realise the damage the resident has caused by making all the paving stones loose now.Hackney council would have to pay to get paving stone relayed reset fixed. Causing problems for elderly residence who cannot walk properly. by stumping their feet on the paving stones and tripping over then have to call for a local ambulance to help the resident in distress up. putting the strain on the ambulance service. Dear Denise Corbin please get your act together. May need further training in her career to benefit residents. Hackney Council passing the buck and not wanting to do their job or pay for the work to be done as usual negligence., 30th October
item.description:
Paving stones loose causing trip hazard to vulnerable elderly people on the Trowbridge estate due to resident using a high pressure jet washer.Maintenance work required.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Reading Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Illegal parking LN25 NUE

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Maidstone Road, New Southgate, London

item.title: Union flags illegally attached to lamp posts. This is causing distress in the local community., 30th October
item.description:
These flags are sending a political message which is offensive to many members of the community. There is a risk someone may try to remove them themselves if they are left there and this could result in injury (ladder use) or confrontation. Please remove these as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Sussex Road, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extremely heavy part of post broken exposing electrics, 30th October
item.description:
I have found this heavy part of the pole exposing the electrics horizontal on the street, twice and twice I have leaned it back against the pole. It needs to be re-attached properly. In the meantime, it is dangerous as it could fall on a child or a dog.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25-32, Marshall Street, Camden Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen leaves from the trees covering the grass verge making it difficukt to reach the foitway., 30th October
item.description:
Grass verge is covered in wet slippery leaves . Leaves from the footway have been cleared, but blown vack onto the grass verge. There us no pavement on my side of the road, and as an elderly overdone I am finding it difficult to cross the road to the footway. The verge was re seeded last year as the grass does mot grow back when the leaves are not cleared away. Please would you include this in your leafing programme this year.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 166, Leesons Hill, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Westhurst Drive, Chislehurst, London

item.title: Footpath alongside the road in abysmal condition, 30th October
item.description:
The footpath parallel to the road leading to Holyfield Hall Farm is abundant with uplifting tree roots, cracks and large ruts. Please can the reparation of this footpath be arranged; currently, it is very hazardous.
Report on FixMyStreet

This is a tight street and this car has parked on the other side of the road which is a no parking this means that my deliveries can't reach my property

item.title: I am a resident and I live on the ground floor and struggled to access communal garden because of these reasons. Hackney Council garden team have forgotten to cut grass.Hackney Council garden team cannot access communal grass area near back fire escape route or do required maintenance because the landlord has sectioned of part of the communal garden which is blocking residents fire escape route. Overgrown grass causing trip Hazard for elderly residence with motability issues. Resident should not be paying their ground maintenance fees due to not being able to use the communal ground area., 30th October
item.description:
Hackney Council garden maintenance team cutting communal grass at 8am this morning. Garden team have forgot to cut section of grass Garden maintenance team required again. If someone could please investigate and do your job's properly much appreciated.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Daintry Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Green/Yellowish water surfacing from Street asphalt, 30th October
item.description:
I observed this for a few weeks now. At the beginning of Station Crescent, right in front of the Royal Mail Postbox (Westcombe hill side) there are a few potholes in the street asphalt and a sort of coloured water is surfacing. There doesn't appear to be any smell. I contacted Thames Water and, after inspection, they told me it's not their problem and to contact the council.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Crescent, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A board and bin obstruction, 30th October
item.description:
A board outside coffee shop and bin on pavement making it dangerous to blind and partially sighted and narrowing the amount of of room for pedestrians, especially those with double buggies

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 160, Halfway Street, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
